content: अंतर् {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} [अम्-अरन् तुडागमश्च <ls>Uṇ. 5. 60</ls>, अमेस्तुट्च] {@--1@} (Used as a prefix to verbs and regarded as a preposition or गति) ({%a%}) In the middle, between; in, into, inside; °हन्, °धा, °गम्, °भू, °इ, °ली &c. ({%b%}) Under {@--2@} (Used adverbially) ({%a%}) Between, betwixt, amongst, within; in the middle or interior, inside (<ab>opp.</ab> बहिः); अदह्यतांतः <ls>R. 2. 32</ls> burnt within himself, at heart; अंतरेव विहरन् दिवानिशं <ls>R. 19. 6</ls> in the palace, in the harem; so °भिन्नं भ्रमति हृदयं <ls>Māl. 5. 20</ls>; अंतर्बिभेद <ls>Dk. 13</ls>; यदंतस्तन्न जिह्वायां <ls>Pt. 4. 88</ls>; अंतर्यश्च मृग्यते <ls>V. 1. 1</ls> internally, in the mind. ({%b%}) By way of seizing or holding; अंतर्हत्वा गतः (हतं परिगृह्य). {@--3@} As a separable preposition ({%a%}) In, into, between, in the middle, inside, within, (with <ab>loc.</ab>); निवसन्नंतर्दारुणि लंघ्यो वह्निः <ls>Pt. 1. 31</ls>; अंतरादित्ये Ch. <ls>Up.</ls>; अंतर्वेश्मनि <ls>Ms. 7. 223</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 302</ls>; अप्स्वंतरमृतमप्सु <ls>Rv. 1. 23. 19.</ls> ({%b%}) Between (with <ab>acc.</ab>) <ab>Ved.</ab> अंतर्मही बृहती रोदसीमे <ls>Rv. 7. 87. 2</ls>; अंतर्देवात् मर्त्यांश्च <ls n="Rv.">8. 2. 4</ls>; हिरण्मय्योर्ह कुश्योरंतरवहित आस <ls>Śat. Br.</ls> ({%c%}) In, into, inside, in the interior, in the midst (with <ab>gen.</ab>); प्रतिबलजलधेरंतरौर्वायमाणे <ls>Ve. 3. 5</ls>; अंतःकंचुकिकंचुकस्य <ls>Ratn. 2. 3</ls>; बहिरंतश्च भूतानां <ls>Bg. 13. 15</ls>; त्वमग्ने सर्वभूतानामंतश्चरसि साक्षिवत् <ls>Y. 2. 104</ls>; लघुवृत्तितया भिदां गतं बहिरंतश्च नृपस्य मंडलं <ls>Ki. 2. 53</ls>; अंतरीपं यदंतर्वारिणस्तटं <ls>Ak.</ls>; <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab> at the end; कूपांतः पतितः <ls>Pt. 5</ls>; सभांतः साक्षिणः प्राप्तान् <ls>Ms. 8. 79</ls>; दंतांतरधिष्ठितं <ls>Ms. 5. 141</ls> between the teeth; उत्पित्सवोंऽतर्नदभर्तुः <ls>Śi. 3. 77</ls>; also in compound with a following word; अहं सदा शरीरांतर्वासिनी ते सरस्वती <ls>Ks. 4. 11.</ls> {@--4@} It is frequently used as the first member of compounds in the sense of ‘internally,’ ‘inside,’ ‘within,’ ‘in the interior,’ ‘having in the interior,’ ‘filled with,’ ‘having concealed within,’ or in the sense of ‘inward,’ ‘internal,’ ‘secret,’ ‘hidden’ &c., forming Adverbial, Bahuvrīhi or Tatpuruṣa compounds; कुंदमंतस्तुषारं (<ab>Bah.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab>) <ls>Ś. 5. 19</ls> filled with dew; °तोयं (<ab>Bah.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab>) <ls>Me. 64</ls>; अंतर्गिरि (Adv. <ab>comp.</ab>) <ls>Ki. 1. 34</ls>; ज्वलयति तनूमंतर्दाहः (<ab>Tat.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab>) <ls>U. 3. 31</ls>; so °कोपः, °कोणः, °आकूतं &c. {@--5@} It is also supposed to be a particle of assent (स्वीकारार्थक). ({%Note%}. In <ab>comp.</ab> the र् of अंतर् is changed to a visarga before hard consonants, as अंतःकरणं, अंतःस्थ &c.). [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%inter%}; Zend {%antare%}; <ab>Goth.</ab> {%undar%}; Pers. {%andar%}; <ab>Gr.</ab> {%entos%};].
